channel.title: Icarus's Wings - A blog of oracleyue
channel.description: Recent content on Icarus's Wings - A blog of oracleyue

item.title: About
item.description: This is the blog of Zuogong YUE, a place to keep his technical notes and articles. Biography Work Experience Apr 2019 - Present: Postdoctoral fellow at School of Electrical Engineering and Telecommunications, the University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia Mar 2018 - Mar 2019: Postdoctoral research associate and PhD at Luxembourg Centre for Systems Biomedicine, Luxembourg Research Interests network inference/reconstruction system identification machine learning linear and nonlinear systems signal processing To get more about his work, please visit

item.title: How to convert DJVU to PDF with table of contents
item.description: This article is based on the answer by pyrocrasty on StackExchange, and kcroker's dpsprep. It tells the essential idea and tools to convert DJVU to PDF with TOC preserved. A python script is given at the end to ease your usage.

item.title: Understanding characteristics of ensemble methods
item.description:
Note: This article is an answer written by image_doctor to the question Base classifiers for boosting on StackExchange on 23 Mar 2012 at 13:20.

There are some characteristics which may add insight to an understanding of ensemble methods.

item.title: Useful commandline tools in Linux/Mac OS X
item.description:
This article keeps collecting useful command-line tools in Linux or Mac OS X (via homebrew). It will be continuously updated.

It includes the following functions:

  • tools for downloading videos or webpages;

  • useful tools on dealing with documents (.txt, .pdf, .djvu, etc.);

  • tricks on image operations, like resize, format conversion, etc.; and

  • basic video operations.

item.title: Setup powerline in Vim for Linux/OS X
item.description: To use powerline in VIM, the default plugin vim-powerline may have been out-of-date. I suggest to use the modern plugin, vim-airline, which provides amazing status-bar settings and powerline styles. In additional, it has accompanied plugin vim-airline-themes to allows users to easily adjust powerline styles.

item.title: Show applications in tiling or overlapping mode in i3
item.description: This blog collects some key but tricky configurations that used for i3 window manager. For more, one may refer to the official user’s guide.

item.title: Keyring supports for Git to avoid repeating passwords
item.description: This article guides you how to set up keychain/keyring to avoid typing your password repeatedly, when using git.

item.title: Useful commands in Emacs for efficient editing
item.description:
This article keeps collecting useful commands/keybindings in Emacs for efficient editing.

⚠️ Warning: It may rely on certain configurations (see my .emacs.d on github). If you found some keybindings are not defined, please refer to the configuration files.

item.title: Linux下快速浏览粘贴表情的解决方案
item.description: 长期以来，Linux下楼主只能按一般方式用file manager查找和插入图片的方式，由于 表情一般很多而导致查找非常不便。一不留神，终于让楼主发现了一个好的解决方法。

item.title: Hugo and Even: notes and demo preview
item.description:
References

  • Moving from Hexo to Hugo
  • Quick start - Hugo
  • Host on Github
  • Front matter - Hugo

item.title: 关于Emacs更新到26之后的配置更新汇总
item.description:
更新的Emacs26之后还是给我带来了一些bug问题，浪费点时间调试（主要还是自己不懂），总结下惠及大家，我抛砖引玉了：

  • daemon的启动和emacsclient链接问题，
  • transparent titlebar的加载问题，
  • 新的native line number display。

item.title: Install Emacs on Mac OS X: daemon, automator app and multiple themes
item.description: This is a quick note on the setup of Emacs on Mac OS X.

item.title: Fix the bug of taglist.vim on iTerm2
item.description: This is a quick note on how to resolve the bug of taglist for Vim running on iTerm2.

item.title: TeXShop for the minted package
item.description: This is a quick note on essential configurations of TeXShop to compile LaTeX using the minted package. It works for the operation system OS X.
